be.belgium.eid.security
Class CertificateChain

java.lang.Object
  be.belgium.eid.security.CertificateChain

public class CertificateChain
extends java.lang.Object

The certificate chain class represents the chain of certificates that are to be verified to verify the data on a certain smart card. The authentication and signature certificates are verified by the certificate of the Certificate Authority which is by itself again verified against the root certificate which is self-signed (meaning that it can sign it's own validity).

Version:
1.0.0 25 Mar 2008
Author:
Kristof Overdulve

Constructor Detail

CertificateChain

public CertificateChain(SmartCard card)
                 throws CardNotFoundException,
                        javax.smartcardio.CardException,
                        java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                        java.io.IOException
Initializes the certificate chain by reading all the certificates in the chain from the smart card and to verify them.

Parameters:
card - is the smart card to fetch the certificate data from
Throws:
javax.smartcardio.CardException - when a card related error occurred
CardNotFoundException - indicates that the card wasn't present in the system or was reset
java.io.IOException - when the certificate couldn't be parsed because the file system is read only
java.security.cert.CertificateException - when the instance couldn't be parsed

CertificateChain

public CertificateChain(RootCertificate rootCert,
                        CACertificate caCert,
                        AuthenticationCertificate authCert,
                        SignatureCertificate sigCert)
Initializes the certificate chain by filling the data with existing certificates.

Parameters:
rootCert - is the root certificate
caCert - is the certificate authority certificate
authCert - is the authentication certificate
sigCert - is the signature certificate
